intro: Swartzia erythrocarpa, commonly known as the red-fruited swartzia, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces bright red, fleshy pods that contain seeds surrounded by a sticky, resinous pulp. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Swartzia erythrocarpa is valued for its ornamental qualities and has some traditional uses in local communities.
